title.narrative: Horn of Africa - food security and resilience - programme management

description.narrative:
The programme is regional, with one component - implemented through the Intergovernmental Authority on Development (IGAD) - addressing regional resilience coordination, lesson learning and exchange, applied research and natural resource governance, and two major components being implemented in Somalia and Ethiopia respectively and supporting tangible improvements in local food production capacity and associated income-generating opportunities in the agricultural and pastoral value chains. The programme is for an initial three-year period with the overall objective of ¿Improved capacity for food production, associated income generation and governance of natural resources in the drylands of the Horn of Africa, benefitting local poverty reduction, food security and resilience¿.
The immediate objectives are: Regional drylands resilience coordination, knowledge sharing, applied research and natural resource governance in the Horn of Africa are improved within the selected areas of support. Rural and peri-urban households and communities in Somalia have enhanced resilience, income and livelihood options through enhanced food productive sectors and basic services that build capacities for a resilient agricultural production and rural income-generation activities. Improved food security and an increase in the productive assets of food insecure households in drylands areas of Ethiopia.
The Programme is implemented through three components, which are: (1) Component 1: Regional drylands resilience coordination, knowledge sharing, governance and applied research. (2) Component 2: Support to food productive capacities and resilience in Somalia (3) Component 3: Support to food and natural resource productive capacities in the drylands of Ethiopia.
